Recommendations News¶

Recommendation News are all newses that are classified to be displayed in recommendation.

ot_api.api.OpentopicApi.get_all_recommendation_news(recommendation_pk)¶

Get all news from Recommendation

Parameters:recommendation_pk (int) – Id of Recommendation
Returns:iterator of ot_api.recommendation_news.models.RecommendationNews
Example: 
>>> from ot_api.api import OpentopicApi
>>> api = OpentopicApi(account_name='account_slug', username='username', password='password')
>>> news = api.get_all_recommendation_news(recommendation_pk=123)
>>> for n in news:
>>>     print(n.title)
Profiling Python using cProfile: a concrete case
10 Reasons Python is Awesome
Doing Math with Python Available now!
Ubuntu 14.10 Has Reached End of Life, Upgrade to Ubuntu 15.04 Now
The Next Industrial Revolution Should Happen In America
Quantitative Research in Python: Using Notebooks
SciPy 2015: Scientific Computing with Python Conference
Why the Ubuntu developer portal moved to DjangoCMS
Python video: P is better than NP :)
Ubuntu may beat Windows 10 to phone-PC convergence after all
class ot_api.recommendation_news.models.RecommendationNews(**kwargs)¶

Represent single ChannelNews object.

Parameters:
  • pk – unique news index value
  • title – title of the news, it’s title that news was published with
  • description – description (body) of the news, it’s description that news was published with
  • description_plain – same as description, except that html is excluded
  • url – url of the news, depends on publication options might be original url or blog url if news was already published to blog platform (wordpress), also depends on options might be short or long version
  • image – url to original image attached to news
  • keywords – keywords for content
  • popularity – total popularity from social medias
  • twitter_count – number of twitter shares
  • facebook_like_count – number of facebook shares
  • linkedin_share_count – number of linkedin shares
  • googleplus_share_count – number of g+ shares
  • sorting_factor – int value represent opentopic algo score
